ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We worked on close reading, pulling out trends, how to understand and discuss interpretations of classical texts (mostly biblical but some others)
methodology of biblical interpretation, a lot of really interesting sources
I learned how to think about texts and authors as interpretation. It was a great class.
How to read a text carefully
A ton of knowledge about Midrash and different interpretations of the Pentateuch

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: discussion format with everyone, selection of readings, reasonable reading expectations
Weaknesses: I wish this class could extend into summer and next semester!

strengths: super interesting, Prof Hayes may be the most understanding and kind and passionate teacher ive had. 
weaknesses: it often felt like she had a specific point she wanted us to get to and didnt necessarily take into account our contributions

The course was great -- Prof. Hayes is amazing. I think sometimes it felt repetitive because we only focused on two central texts, but that was also the course's strength -- we went really in depth, which was great.

Strengths - the whole class was pretty much awesome, fun, and engaging, I especially liked that we were assigned readings to present in class

Weaknesses - the only weakness was pretty minor, which was that the layout of the canvas site was somewhat confusing

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes absolutely. The material is I credibly interesting and by focusing on two cases, we are able to get INCREDIBLY deep into detail and get into the material it's really awesome. The prof is also the most caring professor I've had in my four years and super into the material, and also just the vibes of the class were immaculate this semester. Like it's guaranteed to be a good time if you have literally any interest in the material
yes! if you are interested in biblical interpretation and want to be exposed to one of the best professors at Yale!

Yes, would definitely recommend. The hebrew prerequisite is important, and I think the class would be difficult without some background knowledge, but that said, if you meet those criteria, for sure take it.
If youre looking at the course reviews for this class, you should take it.
Yes, if you have a background in Hebrew and are interested in the subject matter, this is a very good class
